message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.IR. 

The paper proposes a transfer learning framework for human activity recognition using sensor data. This involves learning structural similarities between activity patterns in different domains and autonomously learning activity labels. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning) as the paper focuses on developing a framework for learning from data. The paper also involves aspects of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) as it deals with recognizing human activities. Computer vision (cs.CV) is also relevant as the paper deals with sensor data. Human-computer interaction (cs.HC) is another possible sub-category as the paper discusses the use of activity recognition in various applications. Finally, information retrieval (cs.IR) is also relevant as the paper deals with finding optimal mappings between different domains.
